content.description: R.O.U.Ss is easy dispatched with a little fire and perseverance. Standing start on small side clings so you can gain the ledge. Then throw big to the top of the overhang. Then with a little high foot action pull over the top.
content.protection: Bring a couple crash pads so you have a good landing area.
content.location: If you follow the boulders to the right of the top access Trail in the small Alcove you should run into ROUSs. It's one of the most recognizable boulders in the area.

content.description: Start on your choice of two lower ledges, make your way up to a crimp rail, and then throw for the top.
content.location: On the way up the hill from the parking lot, you will see it before arriving at Inconceivable.

content.description:
This is a simple solid V2 with a cool undercling start. Yellow= hand holds, blue=foot holds To start: match on bottom lip with left foot on bottom foot hold and high right toe hook behind the right jaw. Work hands across bottom lip, match right hand to right toe, big left slap to the slopey snoot with right foot on right most foot hold. To top big juggy hole at the top of the head and a high left head on left side of the mouth.

 An extra jug just left of the big sharp crack and a sharp crimp above that
content.protection: pad and maybe a spotter for new climbers
content.location:
GPS: 37.968799,-90.535088 

 Directly above and back 30ft from the bigger walls that can be seen from the main field/ parking lot.

content.description: awesome problem. techy moves down low, come around the roof big move up, and commiting moves at the top.

A couple balance moves to start and gain obvious flake/shelf on the roof.  Match on flake/shelf, use good pocket for left foot and go up over a couple solid (though possibly dirty) ledges.  Use the horn feature to mantle over the hump.  May become easier with better worked out feet on the mantle and/or if the top is cleaned to reveal any better top out holds.  [Not sure if this has been climbed before, so listing as FA here.  Please correct if wrong.]
Saw some chalk so I figured why not. Good for warming up. Avoid the ledge for more fun.
content.location: Around the corner from the ancient one. Sit start both hands on left using obviously ledge below to stand.

content.description: This is a group of boulders in top of the hill by the parking lot. With problems in the low Vs great for the beginning boulders.
